page.title: 03HISTORY OF BALDERTON (ctd.)
page.content: coaching station for travellers going North or South. Early in the 19th. century the manor of Newark and its possessions, including Balderton, were sold by the Crown to the Duke of Newcastle. In 1840 a New Hall was built which exactly one century later was converted into a mental hospital. The parish of Balderton now consists of 3,700 acres and is a popular residential area, having grown through the development of both private and council estates during the last few years. The population has risen from some 4,000 in the 1940's to its present figure in excess of 8,000.
